docs.snippet: In an unexpected burst of diplomacy, North Korea’s leader may be playing the role of international statesman while courting an ally that was losing patience with his country.

headline.print_headline: A Burst Of Diplomacy Generates Questions
headline.main: What Kim Jong-un May Get in Reaching Out to China

docs.snippet: Retired Supreme Court Justice John Paul Stevens is calling for the repeal of the Second Amendment to allow for significant gun control legislation.

headline.print_headline: Retired Justice Urges Repeal of Second Amendment
headline.main: Retired Justice Urges Repeal of Second Amendment

docs.snippet: Wrapping up his first trip to the Mideast, South Korean President Moon Jae-in on Tuesday visited his nation's special forces training Emirati soldiers and pledged that peace on the Korean Peninsula would bring new business opportunities.

headline.print_headline: South Korean President Visits His Troops Training Emiratis
headline.main: South Korean President Visits His Troops Training Emiratis

docs.snippet: The S&P 500 and the Dow rose on Tuesday, led by gains in industrial and consumer staple shares, while weakness in technology stocks dragged down the Nasdaq.

headline.print_headline: Wall Street Wavers After Strong Rally, Tech Stocks Struggle
headline.main: Wall Street Wavers After Strong Rally, Tech Stocks Struggle

docs.snippet: Germany's finance ministry expects interest rates to rise in coming years, causing new Minster Olaf Scholz to take steps to cushion additional costs to meet budget goals, Der Spiegel weekly reported on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: German Finance Ministry Sees Hefty Interest Rate Rises-Spiegel
headline.main: German Finance Ministry Sees Hefty Interest Rate Rises-Spiegel

docs.snippet: U.S. consumer confidence fell from more than a 17-year high in March amid stock market volatility, but households remained upbeat about labor market conditions, which could help to support consumer spending.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Consumer Confidence Ebbs, House Prices Surge
headline.main: U.S. Consumer Confidence Ebbs, House Prices Surge

docs.snippet: Vietnamese singer and activist Do Nguyen Mai Khoi, an outspoken campaigner for free speech, was briefly detained at an airport in the capital Hanoi on Tuesday after flying home from Europe, her husband told Reuters.

headline.print_headline: Vietnam Briefly Detains Dissident Singer After European Tour
headline.main: Vietnam Briefly Detains Dissident Singer After European Tour

docs.snippet: The comedian says he doesn’t care whom he offends. But he appears to be obsessed with the topic.

headline.print_headline: The World Is Evolving and Ricky Gervais Isn’t
headline.main: The World Is Evolving and Ricky Gervais Isn’t

docs.snippet: The Russian ex-spy and his daughter left critically ill in a nerve agent attack three weeks ago were probably poisoned at the front door of their home in southwestern England, British police said Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Russian Ex-Spy Likely Poisoned at Front Door, UK Police Say
headline.main: Russian Ex-Spy Likely Poisoned at Front Door, UK Police Say

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: North Korea, Russia, ‘A Wrinkle in Time’: Your Friday Briefing
